text: Senegal at the Olympics is a history which began in 1954. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Senegal was SGL. It is now SEN."Abbreviations, National Olympic Committees," 2009 Annual Report, p. 90 [PDF p. 91 of 94]; retrieved 2012-10-15. ==History== Senegal has been to all Summer Olympic Games held since 1964. Unlike most surrounding nations, Senegal has never missed any Summer Olympics since its independence. Senegal is among the small group of tropical countries that have been in the Winter Olympic Games. Its winter athletes have been in four Winter Olympics since 1984 ==List of medalists== Medal Name Games Sport Event Amadou Dia Ba 1988 Seoul Athletics Men's 400 metre hurdles ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes ==References== ==Other websites== * Senegal at Olympic.org * Senegal profile at London2012.com Olympics Category:Nations at the Olympics
title: Senegal at the Olympics
